channel.title: How do I get rid of this little bastard virus?
channel.description:
I've ran like 10 fucking scans trying to get rid of this little bastard and every time I do, it tells me it'll be deleted after the computer is restarted. Well I've restarted the computer a good 10 times now and it's still there. When I manually try to delete it, it'll tell me it's being used by another person or program. Wtf do I do? It's pissing me off. Here's the picture.
[img]http://img297.imageshack.us/img297/4681/fuckinga.png[/img]

launch in safe mode, delete infected files.

…

item.title: How do I get rid of this little bastard virus?
item.dc:creator: @runefreak10 runefreak10
item.description:
@runefreak10 wrote:

[quote=“Phonecheck, post:22, topic:340604”]The first problem is that SHITTY anti-virus your using, maybe I’m being a little dramatic, its not THAT bad but I hate kaspersky, I’m personally using Bitdefender Internet security 2010, give that a try and see if that removes the virus. if that doesn’t work theres forums DEDICATED to virus/spyware removal such as http://forums.majorgeeks.com/index.php
post the name of that virus in the help section and I’m sure you’ll get the help you need.[/quote]

Kaspersky is one of the best anti-viruses out there… I don’t know what you’re talking about. it’s not shit at all.

And I think I finally got rid of it after 3 days of absolutely nothing but scanning and deleting files.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I get rid of this little bastard virus?
item.dc:creator: @Phonecheck Phonecheck
item.description:
@Phonecheck wrote:

The first problem is that SHITTY anti-virus your using, maybe I’m being a little dramatic, its not THAT bad but I hate kaspersky, I’m personally using Bitdefender Internet security 2010, give that a try and see if that removes the virus. if that doesn’t work theres forums DEDICATED to virus/spyware removal such as http://forums.majorgeeks.com/index.php
post the name of that virus in the help section and I’m sure you’ll get the help you need.

item.source: How do I get rid of this little bastard virus?

item.title: How do I get rid of this little bastard virus?
item.dc:creator: @doom_j doom_j
item.description:
@doom_j wrote:

[quote=“HellRain-T, post:16, topic:340604”][quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=436972.msg3211034#msg3211034 date=1274234595]
I don’t get how people post on this telling me to do something when I obviously state that I have already done that.

boot into safe mode and delete the viruses

The two files don’t show up in safe mode, so I can’t possibly delete them.

You might have to re-install your OS. You could also use the system restore feature if you have windows xp pro.

Just restore your computer to an elier date. Go to Start, Programs, Accessories, System Tools, System Restore, then make sure the bullet labled ‘restore my computer to an elier time’ is selected.

http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/untitled-1.jpg
http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/1-1.jpg
http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/2.jpg

Well apparently the only restore date I have in there is for today 2 minutes ago… -.-

[/quote] People don’t know how to read these days.[/quote]

You quoted me why? You didn’t say in your topic you re-installed your OS, get your facts straight boy.

Read under the line.

Here’s how the thread ends with a line

Linux - Done, I just saved you 15 minutes on your car insurance, no thank yous needed.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I get rid of this little bastard virus?
item.dc:creator: @TabbyKiller TabbyKiller
item.description:
@TabbyKiller wrote:

Transfer you wanted files on a different drive, fully reset the computer, transfer your files back. And then you are virus clean.

The fuck I know about virus, I would just;

krackkid:

Crash the computer…easiest/fastest way.

Read full topic

item.title: How do I get rid of this little bastard virus?
item.dc:creator: @HellRain-T HellRain-T
item.description:
@HellRain-T wrote:

[quote=“runefreak10, post:15, topic:340604”]I don’t get how people post on this telling me to do something when I obviously state that I have already done that.

boot into safe mode and delete the viruses

The two files don’t show up in safe mode, so I can’t possibly delete them.

You might have to re-install your OS. You could also use the system restore feature if you have windows xp pro.

[quote author=runefreak10 link=topic=436972.msg3210933#msg3210933 date=1274229843]

Just restore your computer to an elier date. Go to Start, Programs, Accessories, System Tools, System Restore, then make sure the bullet labled ‘restore my computer to an elier time’ is selected.

http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/untitled-1.jpg
http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/1-1.jpg
http://i344.photobucket.com/albums/p348/tekidder_2008/2.jpg

Well apparently the only restore date I have in there is for today 2 minutes ago… -.-
[/quote][/quote] People don’t know how to read these days.
